Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto(7 ll.) and list of 16 witnesses on verso. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Marriage settlement of the Blemmy born in Egypt Hor-p-' (arpos) son of Pa-by (pabes) and Ta-mr-msha (talamesis?) daughter of Patous. Date. year 24 Choiak 16 of Ptol. Philometor = BC. 157 Jan 16 [...] [cf. no. 10491 above]".
Curator's comments: Kaplony-Heckel, U., Das Getreide-Darlehn P. Haun. Inv. Demot. 2, in K. Ryholt (ed.), Acts of the seventh international conference of Demotic studies. Copenhagen, 2002, 246. Text 8 in Shore's Manuscript Catalogue of Demotic Gebelein Papyri in the British Museum. Publication in progress. (C J Martin/S.E.Thomas). Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT.
Bibliographic references: Pestman 1961 / Marriage and matrimonial property in ancient Egypt : a contribution to establishing the legal position of the woman (p.21) (cited in note 2 as comparison)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (324) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/324)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, loss, delaminating Black ink Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Sandwich: board Window verso Binding: leather (damaged, deteriorated) Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: B
